article.headline: Detroit 60, Wisconsin-Green Bay 42
article.story: GREEN BAY, Wis. (AP) -- Wisconsin-Green Bay has protected its home court well this season, but even the Phoenix couldnt survive a second half like Tuesday night's. Brandon Cotton scored 24 points as Detroit beat Green Bay 60-42 in a Horizon League game. A 12-0 run by the Titans early in the second half helped them break open a close game, and their defense limited the Phoenix to just 16 total points in the second half. Detroit led 31-30 with 16:20 left in the game, but the Phoenix went scoreless for the next 6:20, and managed just one field goal over a 13:16 span. Josh Lawrence had 12 points -- 10 in the first half -- before fouling out to lead Green Bay, which fell to 7-1 at home this season. "This is a tough loss to swallow. As well as we were playing, as much confidence as we were playing with, to come out and play this poorly at home is disappointing," said Green Bay coach Tod Kowalczyk. Green Bay (8-7, 0-2) made just 4 of 22 field goal attempts (18.2 percent) in the second half, including going 1 of 8 from the 3-point line. The 42 points was the Phoenixs lowest total since a 58-37 loss at Butler in February 2003, Kowalczyks first season. "I thought the defense was phenomenal. I thought that was the story of the game," said Detroit coach Perry Watson. Ryvon Covile added 15 points and 13 rebounds for the Titans (4-9, 1-1). The senior center scored 13 of his 15 in the second half, and is working his way back to form after missing all of last season with a knee injury. "Ryvon was huge for us. Those of you who follow this league, now you see what I was missing last year," Watson said. "I thought that was a phenomenal performance by him, along with Brandon (Cotton)." The Phoenix led for most of the first half, but the Titans ended it on a 6-0 run, capped by Cottons 3-pointer at the buzzer, to take a 29-26 halftime edge. Ryan Evanochko, who came in as Green Bays leading scorer at 16.4 points per game, was held to just five points on 2-of-9 shooting. Mike Schachtner had six points and six rebounds for the Phoenix. "We didnt get Ryan Evanochko going, and hes such a key part of this team. He didnt have the fire that hes had normally," Kowalczyk said.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
